homeScreenTemplate:
<script>
  $(".app-body .app-content").bind("DOMSubtreeModified", function() {
    	if($('#homedata').length>0) {
        	$(".app-body  .scrollable").attr("style", "display:none;");
        } else {
        	$(".app-body  .scrollable").attr("style", "display:block;");
        }
  });
  MyCampusApp.rootScope.animatepage = function(currentstyle) {
    $(".app-body").addClass(currentstyle);
  }
  var hideInterval = setInterval(function() {
    var animatecss = $("#animatecss");
    if (!animatecss || animatecss.length <= 0) {
      $.ajax({
        url: "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/daneden/animate.css/master/animate.css",
        dataType: "text",
        success: function(data) {
          $("head").append("<style id='animatecss'>" + data + "</style>");
          clearInterval(hideInterval);
        }
      });
    }
  }, 2000);
  if (!MyCampusApp.rootScope.cangelistadded) {
    MyCampusApp.rootScope.$on("$routeChangeStart", function(event, next, current) {
      $(".app-body").attr("class", "app-body animated ");
    });
    MyCampusApp.rootScope.$on("$routeChangeSuccess", function(event, next, current) {
      currentstyle = "bounceInRight";
      if (next.loadedTemplateUrl == "partials/home.html" && current.loadedTemplateUrl != "partials/home.html") {
        currentstyle = "bounceInLeft";
      } else if (current.loadedTemplateUrl != "partials/home.html") {
        if (next.params.appid == current.params.appid && next.params.appid == next.params.pageid) {
          currentstyle = "bounceInLeft";
        }
        if (MyCampusApp.rootScope.ppage) {
          if (MyCampusApp.rootScope.ppage.appid == next.params.appid && MyCampusApp.rootScope.ppage.pageid == next.params.pageid) {
            currentstyle = "bounceInLeft";
          }
        }
      }
      $(".app-body").addClass(currentstyle);
      $(".app-body").addClass("animated");
      MyCampusApp.rootScope.cpage = next.params;
      MyCampusApp.rootScope.ppage = current.params;
    });
    MyCampusApp.rootScope.cangelistadded = true;
  }
</script>
<style>
  .navbar-app,
  .sidebar,
  #mainSidebar {
    background: none !important;
    border: 0;
  }
  
  .navbar-absolute-bottom {
    display: none;
  }
  
  .navbar-brand {
    display: none !important;
  }
  
  .navbar-absolute-top .fa-bars,
  .navbar-absolute-top .fa-user {
    color: #fff;
  }
  
  #dock {
    background: #000 !important;
    bottom: 0 !important;
  }
  
  .dockicon {
    margin-top: 12px !important;
    margin-right: 8% !important;
  }
  
  .sidebar-scrollable {
    min-height: 100% !important
  }
  
  .list-group {
    margin-bottom: 0 !important;
  }
  
  #appContent {
    height: 100% !important;
    background: #fff !important;
  }
</style>

pages.datatemplate:
• {{wag.DESCRIPTION}}
    {{wag.PLACE}}
    {{wag.CLASS_TIME}}

Counseling Services

About Us Come talk to us about... Contact Us Meet our Staff

About Us

College students experience great challenges in both their academic and personal lives. Many new and important decisions are made during these years. Change is constant, and stress often accompanies these new experiences.

The Office of Counseling Services provides a place for students to discuss these multifaceted changes in a private and confidential setting. Counseling helps students cope with these challenges and make sound decisions. Students who are experiencing serious emotional difficulties, or who require specialized or longer-term treatment, can receive referrals to professional services off campus.

Mission Statement

We seek to support students' health and well-being by providing confidential counseling services, programming, and outreach. Our mission is to assist college students in their cultivation of resilience, personal values, and their positive sense of agency. We are committed to providing compassionate, inclusive, and culturally-competent services to help students manage the continuum of developmental adjustments and mental health concerns.
pages.pageprocessor: function pageprocessorCounselingServicesPage2(pagedef, $scope, $routeParams, $compile, $http, $rootScope, $sce, $window, $location) {var data1 = $compile($(pagedef.datatemplate))($scope);$("#appContent").append(data1);}

pages.datatemplate:
What can we help with?

Here is a list of the most common reasons students might meet with a counselor for support, consultation, or referrals.

  • Stress
  • Adjustment
  • Anxiety
  • Depression
  • Relationships
  • Academic
  • Loneliness
  • Family matters
  • Eating concerns
  • Grief and loss
  • Overcoming test anxiety
  • Performance anxiety
  • Roommate issues
  • Sexuality
  • Time management
  • Alcohol/substance use & misuse
  • Identity
  • Sexual Assault
  • Self esteem
  • Body image

pages.datatemplate:
Contact Us

Department of Counseling Services

How to make an appointment:

Phone: (401)232-6045
Email: bcs@bryant.edu

Office Hours: M-F 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Appointments are recommended(closed in July)

Location:
2nd floor Unistructure, near post office and diagonally across the hall from Faculty Suite H

In case of an emergency contact DPS: (401) 232-6911

National Crisis Hotline

Text HOME to 741741 from anywhere in the United States, anytime, about any type of crisis. A live, trained Crisis Counselor receives the text and responds, free of charge, all from their secure online platform

Noelle Harris, PhD, LMHC, R.Y.T.
Director

Robert A. Richards, MS, LMHC, LCDP
Assistant Director

Jessica Roche, M.A., LMHC
Counselor

Ammy Sena
Intercultural Counselor

pages.pageprocessor: function pageprocessorBryUACEPage2(pagedef, $scope, $routeParams, $compile, $http, $rootScope, $sce, $window, $location) {var data1 = $compile($(pagedef.datatemplate))($scope);$("#appContent").append(data1);}
pages.datatemplate:
About Us

You can find more information about us and register for our Workshops on our Blackboard course.

The Academic Center for Excellence (ACE) is dedicated to empowering Bryant students to achieve their goals of academic success. It is no surprise, then, that Bryants most motivated students use ACE services, as they understand the connection between their academic performance and their professional success. Last year, members of the ACE staff held over 20,000 appointments with Bryant students.

Our goal at ACE is to assist students to become self-reliant, independent, confident learners so that they may successfully meet the demands of their chosen academic curriculums. This is achieved through our internationally accredited peer tutoring program and study skills instruction by our professional staff. This staff engages in a collaborative partnership with students to help them achieve their goals. Professional staff members, peer tutors, and faculty work together to foster a supportive learning environment.

What can we help with?

Drop in to our Math, Accounting, Finance, Economics, and Reading & Writing Labs no appointment necessary!

Schedule appointments with staff specialists in Math and Writing. Learning Specialists are also available for appointment to assist you with reading, note-taking, test preparation, test-taking, time management, and general learning assistance.

Schedule one-on-one half hour or hour appointments with peer tutors. Below is a list of subjects that ACE and the Writing Center offers tutoring in, with tutors specializing in content for specific courses. To book an appointment with a tutor in a course from any of these subjects, please call or visit ACE!

  • Applied Analytics
  • Accounting
  • Actuarial Mathematics
  • Business 400
  • Chinese
  • Communication
  • Economics
  • Finance
  • French
  • Global Studies
  • History
  • Information Systems
  • Italian
  • Literary and Cultural Studies
  • Legal Studies
  • Mathematics
  • Management
  • Marketing
  • Political Science
  • Psychology
  • Science
  • Sociology
  • Spanish
  • Writing

About Us

99% Career Outcomes!

Be part of our statistics: 99 percent of Bryant graduates are either employed or in graduate school within six months of graduation. Start early, follow the four-year plan, and get connected to our center.
